translations.ffv1.slices.slicecrc._description: Enabling this option adds CRC information to each slice. This makes it possible for a decoder to detect errors in the bitstream, rather than blindly decoding a broken slice.
translations.ffv1.slices.slices._description: Each frame is split into this number of slices. This affects multithreading performance, as well as filesize: Increasing the number of slices might speed up performance, but also increases the filesize.

translations.h264_nvenc.frames.rclookahead._descripti: Sets the number of frames to use for ratecontrol and lookahead. Higher value means better quality and increased precision.
translations.h264_nvenc.frames.bdapt._description: When lookahead is enabled, set this to 0 to disable adaptive B-frame decision
translations.h264_nvenc.frames.gopsize._description: Maximum Group of Pictures Structure size in which intra- and inter-frames are arranged. Smaller values increase the video quality.
translations.h264_nvenc.frames.bframes._description: Set max number of B-frames between non-B-frames. 0 means that Bipredective coded picture frames are disabled. If a value of -1 is used, it will choose an automatic value depending on the encoder.
translations.h264_nvenc.frames.refs._description: This parameter lets one specify how many references can be used, through a maximum of 16. Increasing the number of refs increases the DPB (Decoded Picture Buffer) requirement, which means hardware playback devices will often have strict limits to the number of refs they can handle. In live-action sources, more reference have limited use beyond 4-8, but in cartoon sources up to the maximum value of 16 is often useful. More reference frames require more processing power because every frame is searched by the motion search (except when an early skip decision is made). The slowdown is especially apparent with slower motion estimation methods.
translations.h264_nvenc.frames.noscenecut._descriptio: When lookahead is enabled, set this to 1 to disable adaptive I-frame insertion at scene cuts.
translations.h264_nvenc.frames.forcedidr._description: If forcing keyframes, force them as IDR frames.
translations.h264_nvenc.frames.nonrefp._description: Enables automatic insertion of non-reference P-frames.
translations.h264_nvenc.quantizer.qpi._description: Enable to change quantization parameter for I-frames.
translations.h264_nvenc.quantizer.qpp._description: Enable to change quantization parameter for P-frames.
translations.h264_nvenc.quantizer.qpb._description: Enable to change quantization parameter for B-frames.
translations.h264_nvenc.quantizer.spatialaq._descript: Choose AQ Mode how available bits should be distributed between all macroblocks in the video.
translations.h264_nvenc.quantizer.temporalaq._descrip: Choose AQ Mode how available bits should be distributed between all macroblocks in the video.
translations.h264_nvenc.misc.surfaces._description: Blockcount of memory allocated for bitmap rendering.
translations.h264_nvenc.misc.zerolat._description: Indicate zero latency operation (no reordering delay).
translations.h264_nvenc.misc.weightedpred._descriptio: Specifies the use of a scaling and offset, when performing motion compensation. This includes implicit weighted prediction for B-frames, and explicit weighted prediction for P-frames.

translations.libx264.standard.tune._description: Customize to fit your project encoding style.
translations.libx264.standard.level._description: Sets the level flag in the output bitstream (as defined by Annex A of the H.264 standard). This automatic detection is not perfect, and may underestimate the level if you are not using VBV controls to limit the max bitrate. If playback is intended on any consumer level product besides a HTPC, Level 4.1 is the maximum usually supported (Xbox 360, Playstation 3, Popcorn Hour A-100 Media Extender to name a few). The GPU-based DXVA decoders on PCs have a maximum level of 4.1 too. Blu-ray and HD DVD are Level 4.1. Note that x264 treats this setting as an output flag only. It does not take any measures to ensure compliance with the level you specify.
translations.libx264.standard.strategy._description: The encoding mode to use. Choose Average Bitrate (ABR), Constant Rate Factor (CRF) Constant Quantizer (CQP) or even Lossless.
translations.libx264.standard.strategy.bitrate._descr: The average data rate allowed by the encoder.
translations.libx264.standard.strategy.crf._descripti: Lower values mean better quality but increase the processing time.
translations.libx264.standard.strategy.qp._descriptio: Quality level of the video. Lower values mean better quality but increase file size and processing time.
translations.libx264.frames.keyint._description: Maximum Group of Pictures Structure size in which intra- and inter-frames are arranged. Smaller values increase the video quality.
translations.libx264.frames.min-keyint._description: Minimum Group of Pictures Structure size in which intra- and inter-frames are arranged. Smaller values increase the video quality.
translations.libx264.frames.scenecut._description: Sets the threshold for IDR frame placement (read: scene change detection). x264 calculates a metric for every frame to estimate how different it is from the previous frame. If the value is lower than scenecut, an IDR frame is used. The metric is slightly more complex then, but it's a reasonable approximation. Higher values of scenecut increase the number of scenecuts detected.
translations.libx264.frames.bframes._description: Bipredective coded pictures contain motion-compensated difference information relative to previously decoded pictures. 0 is the best precision.
translations.libx264.frames.b-adapt._description: The encoder determines the number of B-frames to use (within the B-frames limit).
translations.libx264.frames.b-bias._description: The encoder chooses more likely higher numbers of B-frames during the adaptive lookahead.
translations.libx264.frames.b-pyramid._description: Allows B-frames to be used as reference frames instead of only I or P-frames.
translations.libx264.frames.ref._description: Controls the size of the DPB (Decoded Picture Buffer). In short, this value is the number of previous frames each P-frame can use as references. B-frames can use one or two fewer, depending on if they are used as references or not.
translations.libx264.frames.slices._description: The encoder divides each frame into X regions and searches for redundancies in other frames only within the respective region.
translations.libx264.frames.slices-max._description: Maximum amount of slices for one frame.
translations.libx264.frames.slice-max-size._descripti: Maximum size of a slice for one frame.
translations.libx264.frames.deblock._description: Controls the loop filter (aka inloop deblocker) which is part of the h264 standard. The loop filter takes a rather large slice of decoding time for a single item, and is responsible for a similar slice of the overall quality output. It is very efficient in terms of encoding time vs. quality gained.
translations.libx264.frames.open-gop._description: Open GOPs have to look at both previous and upcoming frames to create a full image. Those reduce the overall file size.
translations.libx264.frames.no-cabac._description: Context Adaptive Binary Arithmetic Coding is a compression method in the lossless phase of the encoding process that can significantly reduce the required bit rate, especially at high data rates.
translations.libx264.ratecontrol.vbv-maxrate._descrip: VBV underflow signals an encoder rate buffer overflow. VBV overflow signals an encoder rate buffer underflow.
translations.libx264.ratecontrol.vbv-bufsize._descrip: The Video Buffering Verifier bitstream buffer size.
translations.libx264.ratecontrol.vbv-init._descriptio: The Video Buffering Verifier validates that the encoded
translations.libx264.ratecontrol.qpstep._description: Determines for the encoding methods 2-pass and 1-pass bitrate how much the quantizer may fluctuate from one frame to the next.
translations.libx264.ratecontrol.ratetol._description: Only applicable to 1pass bitrate encodes. Sets the percentage that x264 can miss the target average bitrate by. 1.0 = 1%. This means the final average bitrate (and corresponding filesize) will be within about +/- 1% of what you set.
translations.libx264.ratecontrol.ipratio._description: Determines by which factor a P-frame is to be quantized more than the I-frame that uses it as a reference.
translations.libx264.ratecontrol.pbratio._description: Determines by which factor a B-frame is to be quantized more than the P-frame that uses it as a reference.
translations.libx264.ratecontrol.chroma-qp-offset._de: This quantizes the color information (chroma) of the image differently from the brightness information (luma).
translations.libx264.ratecontrol.aq-strength._descrip: Selects the adaptive quantization algorithm that quantizes less detailed image areas more. The saved bits can then be used in other parts of the image for better detail.
translations.libx264.ratecontrol.qcomp._description: Quantizer curve compression factor. 0.0 => Constant Bitrate, 1.0 => Constant Quantizer. Note that adaptive quantization partially replaces the effect of qcomp and x264 will internally raise qcomp to compensate based on the adaptive quantization strength.
translations.libx264.ratecontrol.cplxblur._descriptio: Apply a gaussian blur with the given radius to the quantizer curve. This means that the quantizer assigned to each frame is blurred temporally with its neighbours to limit quantizer fluctuations.
translations.libx264.ratecontrol.qblur._description: Apply a gaussian blur with the given radius to the quantizer curve, after curve compression. Not a very important setting.
translations.libx264.ratecontrol.zones._description: With this option you can specify different CRF rates for different parts of the video. For examle you specify CRF=20 for the full length of the video but you want to use CRF=18.5 from FRAME 27000 to 35000 and CRF=16.5 from 44000 to 49000 and CRF=17.5 from 75000 to 77500 and so on. This option is based on frame numbers.
translations.libx264.ratecontrol.rc-lookahead._descri: Determines how many frames the mb-tree and VBV algorithms are allowed to look into the future. The higher the value, the more memory and computing time is required.
translations.libx264.ratecontrol.no-mbtree._descripti: Disables the default active macroblock tree ratecontrol. Only interesting for very fast encodings at the expense of quality.
translations.libx264.analysis.partitions._description: h264 video is split up into 16x16 macroblocks during compression. These blocks can be further split up into smaller partitions, which is what this options controls. With this option, you enable individual partitions. Partitions are enabled per-frametype (ie I, P, B). The available partitions are: p8x8, p4x4, b8x8, i8x8, i4x4
translations.libx264.analysis.direct._description: Specifies whether temporal or spatial information is used in B-frames to compress direct blocks (i.e. blocks without their own movement vector).
translations.libx264.analysis.direct-8x8._description: Set the size of the direct prediction mode. Enabling direct-8x8 inference (on by default at most levels) may slightly improve quality when used with 8x8dct.
translations.libx264.analysis.merange._description: Defines the size of the area in which motion is searched for.
translations.libx264.analysis.mvrange._description: Defines the max. length of the motion vector.
translations.libx264.analysis.subme._description: Defines the quality level for the subpixel motion search and the partition decision.
translations.libx264.analysis.subme._item_1: SAD mode decision, one qpel iteration
translations.libx264.analysis.subme._item_11: Full RD: disable all early terminations
translations.libx264.analysis.subme._item_7: RD mode decision for all frames
translations.libx264.analysis.psy-rd._description: First number is the strength of Psy-RDO to use (requires subme>=6 to activate). The second number is the strength of Psy-Trellis (requires trellis>=1 to activate). Note that Trellis is still considered 'experimental', and almost certainly is a Bad Thing for at least cartoons.
translations.libx264.analysis.no-chroma-me._descripti: By deactivating, the encoder uses only the luminance for motion search in the brightness information (luma).
translations.libx264.analysis.no-mixed-refs._descript: Prohibits the encoder from selecting reference images not only for each macro block, but for each block partition individually.
translations.libx264.analysis.trellis._description: Trellis weighs between detail preservation and lower data rate by rounding up or down coefficients according to certain criteria.
translations.libx264.analysis.no-dct-decimate._descri: Prevents very small coefficients from being rounded to zero in DCT.
translations.libx264.analysis.no-psy._description: Turn off all psychovisual optimizations. This concerns PsyRD, PsyTrellis and AQ as well as some internal Psy optimizations.
translations.libx264.misc.aud._description: Access unit delimiter can be used for signaling about start of video frame.
translations.libx264.misc.bluray-compat._description: Create video files that will be compatible for Blu-Ray discs.
translations.libx264.misc.fake-interlaced._descriptio: Flag stream as interlaced but encode progressive. Makes it possible to encode 25p and 30p Blu-Ray.
translations.libx264.misc.nal-hrd._description: Signal HRD information. Required for Blu-Ray streams or broadcasts.

translations.libx265.standard.strategy.crf._descripti: Lower values mean better quality but increase the processing time.

translations.libx265.qualityratedistortionoptions.crf: Specify an upper limit to the rate factor which may be assigned to any given frame (ensuring a max QP). This is dangerous when CRF is used in combination with VBV as it may result in buffer underruns.
Specify an lower limit to the rate factor which may be assigned to any given frame (ensuring a min compression factor).
translations.libx265.qualityratedistortionoptions.vbv: Specify the size of the VBV buffer (kbits). Enables VBV in ABR mode. In CRF mode, --vbv-maxrate must also be specified.

Will be used only if vbv-bufsize is also non-zero. Both vbv-bufsize and vbv-maxrate are required to enable VBV in CRF mode.

Note that when VBV is enabled (with a valid --vbv-bufsize), VBV emergency denoising is turned on. This will turn on aggressive denoising at the frame level when frame QP > QP_MAX_SPEC (51), drastically reducing bitrate and allowing ratecontrol to assign lower QPs for the following frames. The visual effect is blurring, but removes significant blocking/displacement artifacts.

Initial buffer occupancy. The portion of the decode buffer which must be full before the decoder will begin decoding. Determines absolute maximum frame size. Must be specified as a fractional value between 0 and 1.

Final buffer emptiness. The portion of the decode buffer that must be available after all the specified frames have been inserted into the decode buffer. Specified as a fractional value between 0 and 1.

This enables basic support for chunk-parallel encoding where each segment can specify the starting and ending state of the VBV buffer so that VBV compliance can be maintained when chunks are independently encoded and stitched together.
translations.libx265.qualityratedistortionoptions.aq-: Adaptive Quantization operating mode. Raise or lower per-block quantization based on complexity analysis of the source image. The more complex the block, the more quantization is used. This offsets the tendency of the encoder to spend too many bits on complex areas and not enough in flat areas.
AQ enabled with auto-variance and bias to dark scene

Adjust the strength of the adaptive quantization offsets. Setting --aq-strength to 0 disables AQ. At aq-modes 2 and 3, high aq-strengths will lead to high QP offsets resulting in a large difference in achieved bitrates.
Adjust the AQ offsets based on the relative motion of each block with respect to the motion of the frame. The more the relative motion of the block, the more quantization is used.
translations.libx265.qualityratedistortionoptions.cut: Enable the use of lookaheads lowres motion vector fields to determine the amount of reuse of each block to tune adaptive quantization factors. CU blocks which are heavily reused as motion reference for later frames are given a lower QP (more bits) while CU blocks which are quickly changed and are not referenced are given less bits. This tends to improve detail in the backgrounds of video with less detail in areas of high motion.
translations.libx265.qualityratedistortionoptions.mul: Enable/Disable multipass analysis refinement along with multipass ratecontrol. Based on the information stored in pass 1, in subsequent passes analysis data is refined and also redundant steps are skipped. In pass 1 analysis information like motion vector, depth, reference and prediction modes of the final best CTU partition is stored for each CTU. Multipass analysis refinement cannot be enabled when 'analysis-save/analysis-load' option is enabled and both will be disabled when enabled together. This feature requires 'pmode/pme' to be disabled and hence pmode/pme will be disabled when enabled at the same time.

Enable/Disable multipass refinement of qp based on distortion data along with multipass ratecontrol. In pass 1 distortion of best CTU partition is stored. CTUs with high distortion get lower(negative)qp offsets and vice-versa for low distortion CTUs in pass 2. This helps to improve the subjective quality. Multipass refinement of qp cannot be enabled when 'analysis-save/analysis-load' option is enabled and both will be disabled when enabled together. 'multi-pass-opt-distortion' requires 'pmode/pme' to be disabled and hence pmode/pme will be disabled when enabled along with it.
translations.libx265.qualityratedistortionoptions.str:
Enables stricter conditions to control bitrate deviance from the target bitrate in ABR mode. Bit rate adherence is prioritised over quality. Rate tolerance is reduced to 50%.

This option is for use-cases which require the final average bitrate to be within very strict limits of the target; preventing overshoots, while keeping the bit rate within 5% of the target setting, especially in short segment encodes. Typically, the encoder stays conservative, waiting until there is enough feedback in terms of encoded frames to control QP. strict-cbr allows the encoder to be more aggressive in hitting the target bitrate even for short segment videos.
translations.libx265.qualityratedistortionoptions.cbq: Offset of Cb chroma QP from the luma QP selected by rate control. This is a general way to spend more or less bits on the chroma channel.
translations.libx265.qualityratedistortionoptions.crq: Offset of Cr chroma QP from the luma QP selected by rate control. This is a general way to spend more or less bits on the chroma channel.
translations.libx265.qualityratedistortionoptions.ipr: QP ratio factor between I and P slices. This ratio is used in all of the rate control modes. Some --tune options may change the default value. It is not typically manually specified.
translations.libx265.qualityratedistortionoptions.pbr: QP ratio factor between P and B slices. This ratio is used in all of the rate control modes. Some --tune options may change the default value. It is not typically manually specified.
translations.libx265.qualityratedistortionoptions.qco: qComp sets the quantizer curve compression factor. It weights the frame quantizer based on the complexity of residual (measured by lookahead). Increasing it to 1 will effectively generate CQP.
translations.libx265.qualityratedistortionoptions.qps: The maximum single adjustment in QP allowed to rate control.
translations.libx265.qualityratedistortionoptions.qpm: Sets a hard lower limit on QP allowed to ratecontrol.
Sets a hard upper limit on QP allowed to ratecontrol.
translations.libx265.qualityratedistortionoptions.rc-: Enables a specialised ratecontrol algorithm for film grain content. This parameter strictly minimises QP fluctuations within and across frames and removes pulsing of grain. Enabled when '-tune' grain is applied. It is highly recommended that this option is used through the tune grain feature where a combination of param options are used to improve visual quality.
translations.libx265.qualityratedistortionoptions.con: Enables VBV algorithm to be consistent across runs. Default disabled. Enabled when '-tune' grain is applied.
translations.libx265.qualityratedistortionoptions.qbl: Apply a gaussian blur with the given radius to the quantizer curve, after curve compression. Not a very important setting.
translations.libx265.loopfilter.deblock._description:
Toggle deblocking loop filter, optionally specify deblocking strength offsets.

<int>:<int> - parsed as tC offset and Beta offset <int>,<int> - parsed as tC offset and Beta offset <int> - both tC and Beta offsets assigned the same value
translations.libx265.analysis.ctu._description: Maximum CU size (width and height). The larger the maximum CU size, the more efficiently x265 can encode flat areas of the picture, giving large reductions in bitrate. However this comes at a loss of parallelism with fewer rows of CUs that can be encoded in parallel, and less frame parallelism as well. Because of this the faster presets use a CU size of 32.
translations.libx265.analysis.dynamic-rd._description:
Increases the RD level at points where quality drops due to VBV rate control enforcement. The number of CUs for which the RD is reconfigured is determined based on the strength. Strength 1 gives the best FPS, strength 4 gives the best SSIM. Strength 0 switches this feature off.

Effective for RD levels 4 and below.
translations.libx265.analysis.intra-refresh._descript: Enables Periodic Intra Refresh(PIR) instead of keyframe insertion. PIR can replace keyframes by inserting a column of intra blocks in non-keyframes, that move across the video from one side to the other and thereby refresh the image but over a period of multiple frames instead of a single keyframe.
translations.libx265.analysis.limit-refs._description:
When set to X265_REF_LIMIT_DEPTH (1) x265 will limit the references analyzed at the current depth based on the references used to code the 4 sub-blocks at the next depth. For example, a 16x16 CU will only use the references used to code its four 8x8 CUs.

When set to X265_REF_LIMIT_CU (2), the rectangular and asymmetrical partitions will only use references selected by the 2Nx2N motion search (including at the lowest depth which is otherwise unaffected by the depth limit).

When set to 3 (X265_REF_LIMIT_DEPTH && X265_REF_LIMIT_CU), the 2Nx2N motion search at each depth will only use references from the split CUs and the rect/amp motion searches at that depth will only use the reference(s) selected by 2Nx2N.

For all non-zero values of limit-refs, the current depth will evaluate intra mode (in inter slices), only if intra mode was chosen as the best mode for atleast one of the 4 sub-blocks.

.You can often increase the number of references you are using (within your decoder level limits) if you enable one or both of these flags.
translations.libx265.analysis.limit-tu._description:
Enables early exit from TU depth recursion, for inter coded blocks.

Level 1 - decides to recurse to next higher depth based on cost comparison of full size TU and split TU.

Level 2 - based on first split subTUs depth, limits recursion of other split subTUs.

Level 3 - based on the average depth of the co-located and the neighbor CUs TU depth, limits recursion of the current CU.

Level 4 - uses the depth of the neighbouring co-located CUs TU depth to limit the 1st subTU depth. The 1st subTU depth is taken as the limiting depth for the other subTUs.
translations.libx265.analysis.max-tu-size._descriptio: Maximum TU size (width and height). The residual can be more efficiently compressed by the DCT transform when the max TU size is larger, but at the expense of more computation. Transform unit quad-tree begins at the same depth of the coded tree unit, but if the maximum TU size is smaller than the CU size then transform QT begins at the depth of the max-tu-size.
translations.libx265.analysis.min-cu-size._descriptio: Minimum CU size (width and height). By using 16 or 32 the encoder will not analyze the cost of CUs below that minimum threshold, saving considerable amounts of compute with a predictable increase in bitrate. This setting has a large effect on performance on the faster presets.
translations.libx265.analysis.amp._description:
Enable analysis of asymmetric motion partitions (75/25 splits, four directions). At RD levels 0 through 4, AMP partitions are only considered at CU sizes 32x32 and below. At RD levels 5 and 6, it will only consider AMP partitions as merge candidates (no motion search) at 64x64, and as merge or inter candidates below 64x64.

The AMP partitions which are searched are derived from the current best inter partition. If Nx2N (vertical rectangular) is the best current prediction, then left and right asymmetrical splits will be evaluated. If 2NxN (horizontal rectangular) is the best current prediction, then top and bottom asymmetrical splits will be evaluated, If 2Nx2N is the best prediction, and the block is not a merge/skip, then all four AMP partitions are evaluated.

This setting has no effect if rectangular partitions are disabled.
translations.libx265.analysis.b-intra._description: Enables the evaluation of intra modes in B slices.
translations.libx265.analysis.cu-lossless._descriptio:
For each CU, evaluate lossless (transform and quant bypass) encode of the best non-lossless mode option as a potential rate distortion optimization. If the global option --lossless has been specified, all CUs will be encoded as lossless unconditionally regardless of whether this option was enabled.

Only effective at RD levels 3 and above, which perform RDO mode decisions.
translations.libx265.analysis.dynamic-refine._descrip: Dynamically switches --refine-inter levels 0-3 based on the content and the encoder settings. It is recommended to use --refine-intra 4 with dynamic refinement.
translations.libx265.analysis.early-skip._description: Measure 2Nx2N merge candidates first; if no residual is found, additional modes at that depth are not analysed.
translations.libx265.analysis.fast-intra._description: Perform an initial scan of every fifth intra angular mode, then check modes +/- 2 distance from the best mode, then +/- 1 distance from the best mode, effectively performing a gradient descent. When enabled 10 modes in total are checked. When disabled all 33 angular modes are checked. Only applicable for --rd levels 4 and below (medium preset and faster).
translations.libx265.analysis.limit-modes._descriptio: When enabled, limit-modes will limit modes analyzed for each CU using cost metrics from the 4 sub-CUs. When multiple inter modes like --rect and/or --amp are enabled, this feature will use motion cost heuristics from the 4 sub-CUs to bypass modes that are unlikely to be the best choice. This can significantly improve performance when rect and/or --amp are enabled at minimal compression efficiency loss.
translations.libx265.analysis.rd-refine._description:
For each analysed CU, calculate R-D cost on the best partition mode for a range of QP values, to find the optimal rounding effect.

Only effective at RD levels 5 and 6.
translations.libx265.analysis.rect._description: Enable analysis of rectangular motion partitions Nx2N and 2NxN (50/50 splits, two directions).
translations.libx265.analysis.rskip._description: This option determines early exit from CU depth recursion. When a skip CU is found, additional heuristics (depending on rd-level) are used to decide whether to terminate recursion. In rdlevels 5 and 6, comparison with inter2Nx2N is used, while at rdlevels 4 and neighbour costs are used to skip recursion. Provides minimal quality degradation at good performance gains when enabled.
translations.libx265.analysis.ssim-rd._description: Enable/Disable SSIM RDO. SSIM is a better perceptual quality assessment method as compared to MSE. SSIM based RDO calculation is based on residual divisive normalization scheme. This normalization is consistent with the luminance and contrast masking effect of Human Visual System. It is used for mode selection during analysis of CTUs and can achieve significant gain in terms of objective quality metrics SSIM and PSNR. It only has effect on presets which use RDO-based mode decisions (--rd 3 and above).
translations.libx265.analysis.tskip-fast._description: Only evaluate transform skip for NxN intra predictions (4x4 blocks). Only applicable if transform skip is enabled. For chroma, only evaluate if luma used tskip. Inter block tskip analysis is unmodified.
translations.libx265.analysis.tskip._description:
Enable evaluation of transform skip (bypass DCT but still use quantization) coding for 4x4 TU coded blocks.

Only effective at RD levels 3 and above, which perform RDO mode decisions.
translations.libx265.analysis.nr-inter._description:
Noise reduction - an adaptive deadzone applied after DCT (subtracting from DCT coefficients), before quantization. It does no pixel-level filtering, doesnt cross DCT block boundaries, has no overlap, The higher the strength value parameter, the more aggressively it will reduce noise.

Enabling noise reduction will make outputs diverge between different numbers of frame threads. Outputs will be deterministic but the outputs of -F2 will no longer match the outputs of -F3, etc.
translations.libx265.analysis.nr-intra._description:
Noise reduction - an adaptive deadzone applied after DCT (subtracting from DCT coefficients), before quantization. It does no pixel-level filtering, doesnt cross DCT block boundaries, has no overlap, The higher the strength value parameter, the more aggressively it will reduce noise.

Enabling noise reduction will make outputs diverge between different numbers of frame threads. Outputs will be deterministic but the outputs of -F2 will no longer match the outputs of -F3, etc.
translations.libx265.analysis.rd._description: Level of RDO in mode decision. The higher the value, the more exhaustive the analysis and the more rate distortion optimization is used. The lower the value the faster the encode, the higher the value the smaller the bitstream (in general).
translations.libx265.analysis.rd._item_0: recon generated (better intra), RDO merge/skip selection
translations.libx265.analysis.rd._item_2: RDO mode and split decisions, chroma residual used for sa8d
translations.libx265.analysis.rdpenalty._description:
When set to 1, transform units of size 32x32 are given a 4x bit cost penalty compared to smaller transform units, in intra coded CUs in P or B slices.

When set to 2, transform units of size 32x32 are not even attempted, unless otherwise required by the maximum recursion depth. For this option to be effective with 32x32 intra CUs, --tu-intra-depth must be at least 2. For it to be effective with 64x64 intra CUs, --tu-intra-depth must be at least 3.

Note that in HEVC an intra transform unit (a block of the residual quad-tree) is also a prediction unit, meaning that the intra prediction signal is generated for each TU block, the residual subtracted and then coded. The coding unit simply provides the prediction modes that will be used when predicting all of the transform units within the CU. This means that when you prevent 32x32 intra transform units, you are preventing 32x32 intra predictions.
translations.libx265.analysis.refine-inter._descripti:
Enables refinement of inter blocks in current encode.

Level 0 - Forces both mode and depth from the save encode.

Level 1 - Evaluates all inter modes at current depth(n) and at depth (n+1) when current block size is one greater than the min-cu-size. Forces modes for larger blocks.

Level 2 - In addition to the functionality of level 1, restricts the modes evaluated when specific modes are decided as the best mode by the save encode.

2nx2n in save encode - disable re-evaluation of rect and amp.

skip in save encode - re-evaluates only skip, merge and 2nx2n modes.

Level 3 - Perform analysis of inter modes while reusing depths from the save encode.
translations.libx265.analysis.refine-intra._descripti:
Enables refinement of intra blocks in current encode.

Level 0 - Forces both mode and depth from the save encode.

Level 1 - Evaluates all intra modes at current depth(n) and at depth (n+1) when current block size is one greater than the min-cu-size. Forces modes for larger blocks.

Level 2 - In addition to the functionality of level 1, at all depths, force (a) only depth when angular mode is chosen by the save encode. (b) depth and mode when other intra modes are chosen by the save encode.

Level 3 - Perform analysis of intra modes for depth reused from first encode.

Level 4 - Does not reuse any analysis information - redo analysis for the intra block.
translations.libx265.analysis.refine-mv._description: Enables refinement of motion vector for scaled video. Evaluates the best motion vector by searching the surrounding eight integer and subpel pixel positions.
translations.libx265.analysis.tu-inter-depth._descrip: The transform unit (residual) quad-tree begins with the same depth as the coding unit quad-tree, but the encoder may decide to further split the transform unit tree if it improves compression efficiency. This setting limits the number of extra recursion depth which can be attempted for inter coded units. Default: 1. which means the residual quad-tree is always at the same depth as the coded unit quad-tree unless the CU was coded with rectangular or AMP partitions, in which case a TU split is implied and thus the residual quad-tree begins one layer below the CU quad-tree.
translations.libx265.analysis.tu-intra-depth._descrip:
The transform unit (residual) quad-tree begins with the same depth as the coding unit quad-tree, but the encoder may decide to further split the transform unit tree if it improves compression efficiency. This setting limits the number of extra recursion depth which can be attempted for intra coded units. Default: 1, which means the residual quad-tree is always at the same depth as the coded unit quad-tree

Note that when the CU intra prediction is NxN (only possible with 8x8 CUs), a TU split is implied, and thus the residual quad-tree begins at 4x4 and cannot split any futhrer.
translations.libx265.psychovisual.psy-rd._description: Influence rate distortion optimizated mode decision to preserve the energy of the source image in the encoded image at the expense of compression efficiency. It only has effect on presets which use RDO-based mode decisions (--rd 3 and above). 1.0 is a typical value.
translations.libx265.psychovisual.psy-rdoq._descripti: Influence rate distortion optimized quantization by favoring higher energy in the reconstructed image. This generally improves perceived visual quality at the cost of lower quality metric scores. It only has effect when --rdoq-level is 1 or 2. High values can be beneficial in preserving high-frequency detail.
translations.libx265.quantization.max-ausize-factor._: It controls the maximum AU size defined in specification. It represents the percentage of maximum AU size used.
translations.libx265.quantization.limit-sao._descript: Limit SAO filter computation by early terminating SAO process based on inter prediction mode, CTU spatial-domain correlations, and relations between luma and chroma.
translations.libx265.quantization.sao-non-deblock._de: Specify how to handle depencency between SAO and deblocking filter. When enabled, non-deblocked pixels are used for SAO analysis. When disabled, SAO analysis skips the right/bottom boundary areas.
translations.libx265.quantization.sao._description: Toggle Sample Adaptive Offset loop filter.
translations.libx265.quantization.signhide._descripti: Hide sign bit of one coeff per TU (rdo). The last sign is implied. This requires analyzing all the coefficients to determine if a sign must be toggled, and then to determine which one can be toggled with the least amount of distortion.
translations.libx265.spatialintra.constrained-intra._: Constrained intra prediction. When generating intra predictions for blocks in inter slices, only intra-coded reference pixels are used. Inter-coded reference pixels are replaced with intra-coded neighbor pixels or default values. The general idea is to block the propagation of reference errors that may have resulted from lossy signals.
translations.libx265.spatialintra.strong-intra-smooth: Enable strong intra smoothing for 32x32 intra blocks. This flag performs bi-linear interpolation of the corner reference samples for a strong smoothing effect. The purpose is to prevent blocking or banding artifacts in regions with few/zero AC coefficients.
translations.libx265.motionsearch.max-merge._descript: Maximum number of neighbor (spatial and temporal) candidate blocks that the encoder may consider for merging motion predictions. If a merge candidate results in no residual, it is immediately selected as a 'skip'. Otherwise the merge candidates are tested as part of motion estimation when searching for the least cost inter option. The max candidate number is encoded in the SPS and determines the bit cost of signaling merge CUs.
translations.libx265.motionsearch.me._description: Generally, the higher the number the harder the ME method will try to find an optimal match. Diamond search is the simplest. Hexagon search is a little better. Uneven Multi-Hexegon is an adaption of the search method used by x264 for slower presets. Star is a three step search adapted from the HM encoder: a star-pattern search followed by an optional radix scan followed by an optional star-search refinement. Full is an exhaustive search; an order of magnitude slower than all other searches but not much better than umh or star. SEA is similar to FULL search; a three step motion search adopted from x264: DC calculation followed by ADS calculation followed by SAD of the passed motion vector candidates, hence faster than Full search.
translations.libx265.motionsearch.merange ._descripti: The default is derived from the default CTU size (64) minus the luma interpolation half-length (4) minus maximum subpel distance (2) minus one extra pixel just in case the hex search method is used. If the search range were any larger than this, another CTU row of latency would be required for reference frames.
translations.libx265.motionsearch.analyze-src-pics._d: Enable motion estimation with source frame pixels, in this mode, motion estimation can be computed independently.
translations.libx265.motionsearch.temporal-mvp._descr: Enable temporal motion vector predictors in P and B slices. This enables the use of the motion vector from the collocated block in the previous frame to be used as a predictor.
translations.libx265.motionsearch.weightb._descriptio: Enable weighted prediction in B slices.
translations.libx265.motionsearch.weightp._descriptio: Enable weighted prediction in P slices. This enables weighting analysis in the lookahead, which influences slice decisions, and enables weighting analysis in the main encoder which allows P reference samples to have a weight function applied to them prior to using them for motion compensation. In video which has lighting changes, it can give a large improvement in compression efficiency.
translations.libx265.motionsearch.subme._description: Amount of subpel refinement to perform. The higher the number the more subpel iterations and steps are performed. At -subme values larger than 2, chroma residual cost is included in all subpel refinement steps and chroma residual is included in all motion estimation decisions (selecting the best reference picture in each list, and chosing between merge, uni-directional motion and bi-directional motion). The 'slow' preset is the first preset to enable the use of chroma residual.
translations.libx265.slicedecision.b-adapt._descripti:
Set the level of effort in determining B frame placement.

With b-adapt 0, the GOP structure is fixed based on the values of --keyint and --bframes.

With b-adapt 1 a light lookahead is used to choose B frame placement.

With b-adapt 2 (trellis) a viterbi B path selection is performed.
translations.libx265.slicedecision.bframe-bias._descr: Bias towards B frames in slicetype decision. The higher the bias the more likely x265 is to use B frames.
translations.libx265.slicedecision.bframes._descripti: Maximum number of consecutive b-frames. Use --bframes 0 to force all P/I low-latency encodes. This parameter has a quadratic effect on the amount of memory allocated and the amount of work performed by the full trellis version of --b-adapt lookahead.
translations.libx265.slicedecision.force-flush._descr: Force the encoder to flush frames.
translations.libx265.slicedecision.force-flush._item_: When all the input pictures are over
Even when the input is not over
translations.libx265.slicedecision.keyint._descriptio: Max intra period in frames. A special case of infinite-gop (single keyframe at the beginning of the stream) can be triggered with argument -1. Use 1 to force all-intra. When intra-refresh is enabled it specifies the interval between which refresh sweeps happen.
translations.libx265.slicedecision.lookahead-slices._:
Use multiple worker threads to measure the estimated cost of each frame within the lookahead. The frame is divided into the specified number of slices, and one-thread is launched per slice. When --b-adapt is 2, most frame cost estimates will be performed in batch mode (many cost estimates at the same time) and lookahead-slices is ignored for batched estimates; it may still be used for single cost estimations. The higher this parameter, the less accurate the frame costs will be (since context is lost across slice boundaries) which will result in less accurate B-frame and scene-cut decisions. The effect on performance can be significant especially on systems with many threads.

The encoder may internally lower the number of slices or disable slicing to ensure each slice codes at least 10 16x16 rows of lowres blocks to minimize the impact on quality. For example, for 720p and 1080p videos, the number of slices is capped to 4 and 6, respectively. For resolutions lesser than 720p, slicing is auto-disabled.

If slices are used in lookahead, they are logged in the list of tools as lslices.
Use multiple worker threads dedicated to doing only lookahead instead of sharing the worker threads with frame Encoders. A dedicated lookahead threadpool is created with the specified number of worker threads. This can range from 0 upto half the hardware threads available for encoding. Using too many threads for lookahead can starve resources for frame Encoder and can harm performance.
translations.libx265.slicedecision.min-keyint._descri: Minimum GOP size. Scenecuts beyond this interval are coded as IDR and start a new keyframe, while scenecuts closer together are coded as I or P. For fixed keyframe interval, set value to be equal to keyint. (0 = auto)
translations.libx265.slicedecision.b-pyramid._descrip: Use B-frames as references, when possible.
translations.libx265.slicedecision.open-gop._descript: Enable open GOP, allow I-slices to be non-IDR.
translations.libx265.slicedecision.radl._description: Number of RADL pictures allowed infront of IDR. Requires fixed keyframe interval. Recommended value is 2-3.
translations.libx265.slicedecision.rc-lookahead._desc: Number of frames for slice-type decision lookahead (a key determining factor for encoder latency). The longer the lookahead buffer the more accurate scenecut decisions will be, and the more effective cuTree will be at improving adaptive quant. Having a lookahead larger than the max keyframe interval is not helpful.
translations.libx265.slicedecision.scenecut-bias._des: This value represents the percentage difference between the inter cost and intra cost of a frame used in scenecut detection. For example, a value of 5 indicates, if the inter cost of a frame is greater than or equal to 95 percent of the intra cost of the frame, then detect this frame as scenecut. Values between 5 and 15 are recommended.
translations.libx265.slicedecision.scenecut._descript: How aggressively I-frames need to be inserted. The higher the threshold value, the more aggressive the I-frame placement. --scenecut 0 or --no-scenecut disables adaptive I frame placement.
translations.libx265.vui.sar._description: Sample Aspect Ratio, the ratio of width to height of an individual sample (pixel). The user may supply the width and height explicitly or specify an integer from the predefined list of aspect ratios defined in the HEVC specification.
translations.libx265.vui.range._description: Specify output range of black level and range of luma and chroma signals.
translations.libx265.vui.colorprim._description: Specify color primaries to use when converting to RGB.
translations.libx265.vui.colormatrix._description: Specify color matrix setting i.e set the matrix coefficients used in deriving the luma and chroma.
translations.libx265.vui.chromaloc._description: Specify chroma sample location for 4:2:0 inputs. Consult the HEVC specification for a description of these values.
translations.libx265.vui.master-display._description: SMPTE ST 2086 mastering display color volume SEI info, specified as a string which is parsed when the stream header SEI are emitted.
translations.libx265.vui.max-cll._description: Maximum content light level (MaxCLL) and maximum frame average light level (MaxFALL) as required by the Consumer Electronics Association 861.3 specification.
translations.libx265.vui.hdr-opt._description: Add luma and chroma offsets for HDR/WCG content. Input video should be 10 bit 4:2:0. Applicable for HDR content. It is recommended that AQ-mode be enabled along with this feature.
translations.libx265.vui.uhd-bd._description: Enable Ultra HD Blu-ray format support. If specified with incompatible encoding options, the encoder will attempt to modify/set the right encode specifications. If the encoder is unable to do so, this option will be turned OFF. Highly experimental.
translations.libx265.bitstream.repeat-headers._descri: If enabled, x265 will emit VPS, SPS, and PPS headers with every keyframe. This is intended for use when you do not have a container to keep the stream headers for you and you want keyframes to be random access points.
translations.libx265.bitstream.aud._description: Emit an access unit delimiter NAL at the start of each slice access unit. If 'repeat-headers' is not enabled (indicating the user will be writing headers manually at the start of the stream) the very first AUD will be skipped since it cannot be placed at the start of the access unit, where it belongs.
translations.libx265.bitstream.hrd._description: Enable the signalling of HRD parameters to the decoder. The HRD parameters are carried by the Buffering Period SEI messages and Picture Timing SEI messages providing timing information to the decoder.
translations.libvpx.standard.quality._description:
Good is the default and recommended for most applications.

Best is recommended if you have lots of time and want the best compression efficiency.

Realtime is recommended for live / fast encoding.
translations.libvpx.standard.strategy.bitrate._descri: The average data rate allowed by the encoder.
translations.libvpx.standard.strategy.crf._descriptio: Lower values mean better quality but increase the processing time.
translations.libvpx.frame.auto-alt-ref._description: Enable use of alternate reference frames (2-pass only)
translations.libvpx.frame.lag-in-frames._description: Number of frames to look ahead for when encoding, 0 no limit
translations.libvpx.misc.sharpness._description: Anything above 0 weakens the deblocking effect of the loop filter.
translations.libvpx-vp9.standard.strategy.bitrate._de: The average data rate allowed by the encoder.
translations.libvpx-vp9.standard.strategy.crf._descri: Lower values mean better quality but increase the processing time.
translations.libvpx-vp9.standard.quality._description:
Good is the default and recommended for most applications.

Best is recommended if you have lots of time and want the best compression efficiency.

Realtime is recommended for live / fast encoding.
translations.libvpx-vp9.frame.auto-alt-ref._descripti: Enable use of alternate reference frames (2-pass only)
translations.libvpx-vp9.frame.lag-in-frames._descript: Number of frames to look ahead for when encoding, 0 no limit
translations.libvpx-vp9.frame.tile-columns._descripti: Number of tile columns to use, log2
translations.libvpx-vp9.frame.tile-rows._description: Number of tile rows to use, log2
translations.libvpx-vp9.misc.sharpness._description: Anything above 0 weakens the deblocking effect of the loop filter.
translations.hap.standard.chunks._description: Specifies the number of chunks to split frames into, between 1 and 64. This permits multithreaded decoding of large frames, potentially at the cost of data-rate. The encoder may modify this value to divide frames evenly.
translations.hap.standard.compressor._description: Specifies the second-stage compressor to use. If set to none, chunks will be limited to 1, as chunked uncompressed frames offer no benefit.
translations.hap.standard.format._description: Specifies the Hap format to encode.
translations.aac.standard.profile._description: Controls properties such as compression algorithm and complexity.
translations.aac.standard.bitrate._description: The bitrate used for encoding audio. Higher bitrate implies better quality. 448+ kbps only supported for surround.
translations.ac3.standard.bitrate._description: The bitrate used for encoding audio. Higher bitrate implies better quality.
translations.libfdk_aac.standard.strategy.b._descript: The bitrate used for encoding audio. Higher bitrate implies better quality.
translations.libfdk_aac.standard.strategy.vbr._descri:
Set VBR mode, from 1 to 5. 1 is lowest quality (though still pretty good) and 5 is highest quality. A value of 0 will disable VBR, and CBR (Constant Bit Rate) is enabled.

Currently only the 'aac_low' profile supports VBR encoding.
translations.libfdk_aac.misc.header_period._descripti: Set StreamMuxConfig and PCE repetition period (in frames) for sending in-band configuration buffers within LATM/LOAS transport layer.
translations.libfdk_aac.misc.signaling._description:
Set SBR/PS signaling style.

It can assume one of the following values:

'default'
choose signaling implicitly (explicit hierarchical by default, implicit if global header is disabled)

'implicit'
implicit backwards compatible signaling

'explicit_sbr'
explicit SBR, implicit PS signaling

'explicit_hierarchical'
explicit hierarchical signaling
translations.flac.compression.compression_level._desc: Higher values result in smaller files, but slightly longer encoding time.
translations.libopus.standard.strategy.vbr_on._descri: In VBR mode the bitrate may go up and down freely depending on the content to achieve more consistent quality.
translations.libopus.standard.strategy.vbr_off._descr: With hard-cbr every frame will be exactly the same size, similar to how speech codecs work. This delivers lower overall quality but is useful where bitrate changes might leak data in encrypted channels or on synchronous transports.
translations.libopus.standard.strategy.vbr_constraine: Outputs to a specific bitrate. This mode is analogous to CBR in AAC/MP3 encoders and managed mode in Vorbis coders. This delivers less consistent quality than VBR mode but consistent bitrate.
translations.libvorbis.standard.strategy._description: The encoding mode to use. Choose Average Bitrate (ABR), Constant Rate Factor (CRF) Constant Quantizer (CQP) or even Lossless.
translations.libvorbis.standard.strategy.abr._descrip: The average data rate allowed by the encoder.
translations.libvorbis.standard.strategy.cqp._descrip: Set constant quality setting for VBR. The value should be a float number in the range of -1 to 10. The higher the value, the better the quality.
translations.filter.atadenoise.standard.s._descriptio: set how many frames to use
translations.filter.bbox.standard.min_val._descriptio: set minimum luminance value for bounding box
